subject: Horse Racing
Horses
lead_paragraph: A horse that did not sell upstaged the ones that did at Keeneland’s September yearling sale. Although the bidding reached $7.7 million for Vallenzeri, an A. P. Indy colt and the first foal out of the former Breeders Cup Distaff champion Azeri, that amount was not enough to pry the horse from the owner Michael Paulson. It was the highest price refused for a horse at a Keeneland sale. Azeri won Horse of the Year honors in 2002 while racing for Paulson’s father, Allen.
